chemoreception.notes: Sea slugs in this family are thought to feed on sponges, suggesting a reliance on chemoreception to locate prey. Some species, like Peltodoris nobilis, are known to emit a strong fruity citrus smell, suggesting chemoreception capabilities.

vision.notes: While not explicitly stated, many nudibranchs have simple eyes. Given their nocturnal behavior (thought to feed at night), vision may play a role in orientation and predator avoidance, but this is uncertain in the context provided.

mechanoreception.notes: As shell-less marine gastropods, Discodorididae likely possess mechanoreceptors for detecting water currents and substrate vibrations, aiding in navigation and predator detection. This is inferred due to their lifestyle.
